means: 使成群，集合( group的现在分词)

sentence.Network_en: These small nations constitute an important grouping within the EU.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些小国家是欧盟中的一个重要小集团。

sentence.Network_en: Educators try to put pupils of similar abilities into classes because they believe that this homogeneous grouping is advisable.
sentence.Network_cn: 教育学家设法将学生按相近的能力分班,因为他们认为这种按同等水平划分班级的做法是明智的.

sentence.Network_en: Another particle grouping is referred to as charge multiplets.
sentence.Network_cn: 粒子的另一分类叫做电荷多重态.

entry.tran: （具有共同点的）一类人（或事物）；小团体；小圈子
entry.def: A grouping is a set of people or things that have something in common.

example.ex: There were two main political groupings pressing for independence.
example.tran: 有两大政治团体力主独立。

means.word_mean: 1. any number of entities (members) considered as a unit
2. the activity of putting things together in groups
3. a system for classifying things into groups

sentences.en: an army grouping along the frontier
